moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. Bg5 h6: Now I think that at the very least I can gain a tempo by attacking the underdefended d4.  I am not afraid of d5 because of Bxc3+.
moves.9. Bc2: Once white played this move, I began to think about getting my bishop to g4 where at the very least I might be able to double the pawns on the kingside.  I was already thinking about maybe getting my knight to d4 adding to the attack on f3.  I thought that if things went exactly my way, I could have mating possibilities.
moves.9... e5 10. d5 Nd4: White can't capture the knight because exd4, a3 dxc3, axb4 cxb2 is strong for black.
moves.11. O-O: White needed to desperately prevent Bg4 by playing h3.  Now he is in big trouble.
moves.11... Bg4 12. Kh1 Bxc3: This is to prevent the knight on c3 from swinging to e2 and then g3 to protect the king.
moves.13. bxc3 Nxf3 14. h3 Qh4: Most class A players would have no difficulty seeing this move.
moves.15. gxf3 Qxh3+ 16. Kg1 Bxf3: Now white could resign, but he plays on a little bit.
moves.18... Qxc3 19. Bb3 f5: I think here white should play f3 to give his king some breathing room.
moves.20. exf5 Rxf5 21. Rbc1: What is the BEST MOVE for black?
moves.21... Qf3: This is much faster the move Qh3 that my students usually pick.   I also thought that Rg5+ would be slower, but after Rg5+, Kh2 Qf3, Rg1 (Be4 Qh5#) Rh5#
